current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To require the Secretary of State to offer rewards of up to $5,000,000 for information regarding the attacks on the United States diplomatic mission at Benghazi, Libya that began on September 11, 2012.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read the first time

action-desc.#text: Read the second time and placed on the calendar
Read the second time and placed on the calendar

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall offer a reward of not more than $5,000,000 to individuals who furnish information—

text.#text: In accordance with the Rewards for Justice program authorized under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 36(b) of the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956/s:36/ss:b

text.#text: regarding the attacks on the United States diplomatic mission at Benghazi, Libya that began on September 11, 2012; or
leading to the capture of an individual who committed, conspired to commit, attempted to commit, or aided in the commission of the attacks described in

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1661 PCS: To require the Secretary of State to offer rewards of up to $5,000,000 for information regarding the attacks on the United States diplomatic mission at Benghazi, Libya that began on September 11, 2012.
